TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WqlEventQuery extends System.Management.EventQuery

Docs.summary: Represents a WMI event query in *WQL* format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This is the default constructor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string queryOrEventClassName) cil managed

Docs.param: The string representing either the entire event query or the name of the event class to query. The object will try to parse the string as a valid event query. If unsuccessful, the parser will assume that the parameter represents an event class name.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the given query string or event class name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> by specifying a query and then initializes a <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> by specifying an event.
[!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S)#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.management.wqle_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S)#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.management.wqle_1_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string eventClassName, string condition) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event class to query.
The condition to apply to events of the specified class.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified event class name, with the specified condition.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string eventClassName, valuetype System.TimeSpan withinInterval) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event class to query.

A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value specifying the latency acceptable for receiving this event. This value is used in cases where there is no explicit event provider for the query requested, and WMI is required to poll for the condition. This interval is the maximum amount of time that can pass before notification of an event must be delivered.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified event class, with the specified latency time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> by specifying an event and a time span value specifying the latency acceptable for receiving this event.
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S_T)#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.management.wqle_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S_T)#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.management.wqle_0_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public WqlEventQuery (string eventClassName, string condition, TimeSpan groupWithinInterval);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string eventClassName, string condition, valuetype System.TimeSpan groupWithinInterval) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event class to query.
The condition to apply to events of the specified class.
The specified interval at which WMI sends one `aggregate event`, rather than many events.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified event class name, condition, and grouping interval.

MemberSignature.Value: public WqlEventQuery (string eventClassName, TimeSpan withinInterval, string condition);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string eventClassName, valuetype System.TimeSpan withinInterval, string condition) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event class to query.

A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value specifying the latency acceptable for receiving this event. This value is used in cases where there is no explicit event provider for the query requested and WMI is required to poll for the condition. This interval is the maximum amount of time that can pass before notification of an event must be delivered.
The condition to apply to events of the specified class.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified event class name, polling interval, and condition.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example creates the event query: "SELECT \* FROM __InstanceCreationEvent *WITHIN* 10 WHERE TargetInstance ISA Win32_Service ", which sends notification of the creation of **Win32_Service** instances, with a 10-second polling interval.
[!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S_T_S)#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/7ec98848-d4d1-4514-bb81-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S_T_S)#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/7ec98848-d4d1-4514-bb81-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public WqlEventQuery (string eventClassName, string condition, TimeSpan groupWithinInterval, string[] groupByPropertyList);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string eventClassName, string condition, valuetype System.TimeSpan groupWithinInterval, string[] groupByPropertyList) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event class to query.
The condition to apply to events of the specified class.
The specified interval at which WMI sends one `aggregate event`, rather than many events.
The properties in the event class by which the events should be grouped.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified event class name, condition, grouping interval, and grouping properties.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public WqlEventQuery (string eventClassName, TimeSpan withinInterval, string condition, TimeSpan groupWithinInterval, string[] groupByPropertyList, string havingCondition);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string eventClassName, valuetype System.TimeSpan withinInterval, string condition, valuetype System.TimeSpan groupWithinInterval, string[] groupByPropertyList, string havingCondition) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event class on which to be queried.

A <xref:System.TimeSpan> value specifying the latency acceptable for receiving this event. This value is used in cases where there is no explicit event provider for the query requested, and WMI is required to poll for the condition. This interval is the maximum amount of time that can pass before notification of an event must be delivered.
The condition to apply to events of the specified class.
The specified interval at which WMI sends one `aggregate event`, rather than many events.
The properties in the event class by which the events should be grouped.
The condition to apply to the number of events.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified event class name, condition, grouping interval, grouping properties, and specified number of events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example creates the event query: "SELECT \* FROM __InstanceCreationEvent WHERE TargetInstance ISA Win32_NTLogEvent GROUP WITHIN 600 BY TargetInstance.SourceName HAVING NumberOfEvents > 15" which delivers aggregate events only if the number of **Win32_NTLogEvent** events received from the same source exceeds 15.
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S_T_S_T_S_S)#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e10c1651-78b4-4df0-ad78-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery(S_T_S_T_S_S)#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e10c1651-78b4-4df0-ad78-_1.vb)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the condition to be applied to events of the specified class.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing the condition or conditions in the event query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new condition.
## Property Value The condition is represented as a string, containing one or more clauses of the form: \<propName> \<operator> \<value> combined with logical operators. \<propName> must represent a property defined on the event class specified in this query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> and displays the event query string.
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_Condition#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_Condition#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_2_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the event class to query.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing the name of the event class in the event query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new class name.
## Property Value A string containing the name of the event class to query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> and displays the event query string.
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_EventClassName#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_6_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_EventClassName#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_6_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets properties in the event to be used for grouping events of the same type.
Docs.value: Returns a containing the properties in the event to be used for grouping events of the same type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new grouping.
## Property Value Null, if no grouping is required; otherwise, a collection of event property names.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> and displays the event query string.
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_GroupByPropertyList#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_GroupByPropertyList#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_1_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the interval to be used for grouping events of the same type.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.TimeSpan> value containing the interval used for grouping events of the same type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new interval.
## Property Value Null, if there is no grouping involved; otherwise, the interval in which WMI should group events of the same type.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> and displays the event query string.
[!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_GroupWithinInterval#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_3_1.vb)] [!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_GroupWithinInterval#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_3_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the condition to be applied to the aggregation of events, based on the number of events received.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing the condition applied to the aggregation of events, based on the number of events received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new grouping condition.
## Property Value Null, if no aggregation or no condition should be applied; otherwise, a condition of the form "NumberOfEvents \<operator> \<value>".
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> and displays the event query string.
[!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_HavingCondition#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_5_1.vb)] [!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_HavingCondition#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_5_1.cs)]

Docs.param: The query string to be parsed.
Docs.summary: Parses the query string and sets the property values accordingly.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the language of the query.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value that contains the query language that the query is written in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value The value of this property in this object is always "WQL".
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public override string QueryString { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the string representing the query.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing the query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A string representing the query.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> and displays the event query string.
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_QueryString#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_QueryString#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_4_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the polling interval to be used in this query.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.TimeSpan> value containing the polling interval used in the event query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property should only be set in cases where there is no *event provider* for the event requested, and WMI is required to poll for the requested condition.
Setting this property value overrides any previous value stored in the object. The query string is rebuilt to reflect the new interval.
## Property Value Null, if there is no polling involved; otherwise, a valid <xref:System.TimeSpan> value if polling is required.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example initializes a new <xref:System.Management.WqlEventQuery> that represents the query: "SELECT \* FROM __InstanceCreationEvent *WITHIN* 1 WHERE TargetInstance ISA 'Win32_Process'".
[!code-cs[wminet_WqlEventQuery_WithinInterval#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.management.wqle_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[wminet_WqlEventQuery_WithinInterval#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.management.wqle_0_1.vb)]
